availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Maysville, Kentucky, physician. Mason County, Kentucky native. Married to Ann Coburn Shackleford on December 26, 1833. Father of John Shackleford, James Shackleford, Charles Shackleford, William Shackleford, and Sprigg Shackleford. Physician in Maysville in 1850 and 1860. Owned four enslaved persons in Maysville in 1850. Owned two enslaved persons in Maysville in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, Maysville, p. 42B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, Maysville, p. 3.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, Maysville, p. 40.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, Maysville, p. 2.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, Maysville, Ward 3, p. 6.
Marriage Records: Kentucky Marriages, (Richmond, KY: Madison County Courthouse), film no. 000281842, p. 351.
Find A Grave, "Dr John Shackleford (1801-1885)," Memorial #22985342, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/22985342 (accessed December 15, 2018).
